page.title: 16HAYWOOD FARM
page.content: {BEFORE 1980 Haywood Farm has changed a lot during the 1980's. I used to live there but my parents who rented it, left the farm in 1980, because they could not afford to buy it from the owner. We interviewed{my mother}and this is what it was like when we left it. Food had to be taken to the animals and to the cow which had to be milked by hand.It was hard because you had to clean out the animals and put down clean straw.My mother Mrs Vaughan enjoyed it on the farm anyway. The main jobs were feeding and shearing the sheep but Mrs Vaughan did not shear the sheep but once she did by using hand shears. The sheep had to be dipped. Mrs Vaughan went to help with the haymaking on the big farm near by. The hay was put in the barn for winter.
